title: Nifty 50 Hits All-Time High as IT Stocks Rally
text: The Nifty 50 index reached a new all-time high today, driven by strong performance in IT stocks following positive quarterly results from major tech companies. Analysts remain bullish on the market outlook.

title: Banking Stocks Lead Nifty 50 Gains
text: Banking stocks led the gains in Nifty 50 today as investors responded positively to the RBI's latest policy announcements. HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank were among the top performers.

title: Market Sentiment Improves as Inflation Concerns Ease
text: Market sentiment improved significantly as the latest inflation data showed signs of easing, reducing concerns about aggressive rate hikes. The Nifty 50 closed higher by 1.2%.

title: Nifty 50 Consolidates After Recent Rally
text: The Nifty 50 index consolidated today after the recent rally, with mixed performance across sectors. Analysts suggest this is a healthy pause before the next leg up.

title: Auto Stocks Drag Nifty 50 Lower on Supply Chain Concerns
text: Auto stocks dragged the Nifty 50 lower today as concerns about global supply chain disruptions resurfaced. Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors were among the biggest losers.

title: Pharma Stocks Shine as Nifty 50 Ends Flat
text: Pharmaceutical stocks shined today even as the broader Nifty 50 index ended flat. Sun Pharma and Dr. Reddy's Labs reported strong gains on positive drug trial results.

title: Nifty 50 Declines on Global Cues
text: The Nifty 50 declined today following weak global cues, particularly from US markets. Technology and metal stocks were the worst performers.

title: Oil Price Surge Impacts Nifty 50 Sentiment
text: A surge in global oil prices negatively impacted market sentiment today, with the Nifty 50 closing lower. Energy stocks were mixed while airlines and FMCG stocks faced selling pressure.

title: Nifty 50 Rebounds on Strong IIP Data
text: The Nifty 50 rebounded strongly today after the release of better-than-expected Industrial Production (IIP) data. Capital goods and manufacturing stocks led the gains.

title: FII Buying Boosts Nifty 50
text: Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) turned net buyers, providing a significant boost to the Nifty 50 index. Banking and financial services stocks were the major beneficiaries.

title: Nifty 50 Volatile Ahead of Earnings Season
text: The Nifty 50 remained volatile today as investors positioned themselves ahead of the quarterly earnings season. Market breadth remained positive despite the volatility.

title: IT Stocks Under Pressure as Nifty 50 Declines
text: IT stocks came under pressure following disappointing guidance from a major US tech company, dragging the Nifty 50 lower. TCS and Infosys were among the top losers.

title: Nifty 50 Gains on Positive Global Cues
text: The Nifty 50 gained today on positive global cues, particularly from Asian markets. Metal and energy stocks were the top performers.

title: RBI Policy Boosts Market Sentiment
text: The Reserve Bank of India's accommodative policy stance boosted market sentiment, with the Nifty 50 closing higher. Banking and financial stocks rallied significantly.

title: Nifty 50 Declines on Profit Booking
text: The Nifty 50 declined today as investors booked profits after the recent rally. Most sectoral indices ended in the red, with only defensive sectors showing resilience.
